H0.text: Coal warms most of the air, water, and land on Earth.

H1.text: Electricity warms most of the air, water, and land on Earth.

H2.text: Sunlight warms most of the air, water, and land on Earth.

H3.text: Wind warms most of the air, water, and land on Earth.

A4.text: Sunlight on the surface of Earth is attenuated by Earth's atmosphere, so that less power arrives at the surface (closer to 1,000 W/m2) in clear conditions when the Sun is near the zenith.

A5.text: The solar constant is equal to approximately 1,368 W/m2 (watts per square metre) at a distance of one astronomical unit (AU) from the Sun (that is, at or near Earth's orbit).
